'''Evadrien''' was a region of the island of [[Luthany|Lúthien]], according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in the text called ''[[Ælfwine of England]]'' from ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.<ref name="Eva"/> It is equated with the legendary drowned kingdom of [[wikipedia:Lyonesse|Lionesse]], located between [[wikipedia:Cornwall|Cornwall]] and the [[wikipedia:Isles of Scilly|Scilly Isles]].<ref>{{LT2|Index}}, p. 370</ref>

[[Éadgifu]], mother of [[Ælfwine]], came from these lands. She was a friend of the [[Elves]] that still dwelt in Lúthien, many of whom lived in Evadrien.<ref name="Eva">{{LT2|VIb}}, pp. 313-4</ref>

It also contained the harbour of [[Belerion]], from which the Elves of Lúthien sailed to [[Tol Eressëa]].<ref>{{LT2|VIb}}, pp. 314-5</ref>

== Etymology ==
The name ''Evadrien'' is in [[Qenya]], meaning "Coast of Iron".<ref name="Eva"/>

An earlier form of the name was ''Erenol''.<ref>{{LT2|VIb}}, ''Changes made to names, and differences in names, in the texts of Ælfwine of England'', p. 334</ref> 

It was also called '''''Lionesse'''''.<ref name="Eva"/>
